alert.note: Alert for Bay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 02 at 9:37AM EST until December 02 at 12:45PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Bay County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 1145 AM CST. * At 837 AM CST, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Several roads across Panama City and Panama City Beach are becoming impassable due to heavy rain. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen across the area this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Panama City Beach, Callaway, Springfield, Hiland Park, Tyndall Air Force Base, Parker, Millville, Bay Harbor, Cedar Grove, Beacon Beach, Dirego Park, Magnolia Beach, St Andrews State Park, Brannonville, Biltmore Beach, Gulf Lagoon Beach, West Panama City and Edgewater Gulf Beach. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
